title: Home Gold Shines on Day 1 in Tashkent
desc: Day one of the OTP Group Tashkent Grand Slam 2026 delivered thrilling action. Hui Xinran claimed -48kg gold, Abe Hifumi stunned with the throw of the day, and Shukurjon Aminova secured Uzbekistan’s first gold. A bronze from Doston Ruziev capped a proud start for the host nation.

title: Team makes an ear in the lab
desc: Researchers have produced ear cartilage that remains stable in animal models.

title: Nasa announces Artemis III mission no longer aims to send humans to moon
desc: Plans to return humans to the moon will come in later mission as agency grapples with delays and glitches

title: Ramadan 2026: Sport climber Sam Watson looks back on his 2025 fasting experience as a non-Muslim
desc: The Paris 2024 bronze medallist spoke to Olympics.com about his experiences trying fasting last year alongside his Indonesian climbing friends, and why he wants to do so again in the future as a non-Muslim.

title: The Best Perfumes of 2026 Are Already Rolling Out
desc: New year, new scent? There’s already several brand new perfume launches to choose from. We included picks from Parfums de Marly, YSL Beauty, Le Labo, and more.

title: Boris Johnson drops new Andrew bombshell - 'I had to ban him'
desc: Boris Johnson spoke about his last meeting with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

title: Bruno Mars: The Romantic review - you’re better off listening to the songs he’s blatantly imitating
desc: (Atlantic)Harking back to Oye Como Va, Move On Up and other 20th-century classics, Mars’s homages are beautifully performed but bereft of new ideas

title: Super League is NRL’s secret weapon as 12,000 English fans head to Vegas
desc: Hull KR face Leeds in Sin City on Saturday, with the supporters they bring in tow illustrating the league’s value to the global game

title: TCL releases RayNeo Air 4 Pro smart glasses for $249
desc: TCL's RayNeo Air 4 Pro smart glasses are a "head-mounted TV" with vibrant, HDR-capable OLED displays. Grab these new smart glasses with a $50 discount.

title: Meta's Defense In Social Media Addiction Trial Is Basically A Shrug
desc: Last week, Mark Zuckerberg sat in a Los Angeles courtroom and testified for five hours that he and his company, Meta, are not culpable in claims that they have deliberately made the platform addictive and harmful for young users.  The testimony was part of a bellwether trial in California in which a 20-year-old woman, referred…
